ocps.title: Orange County Plastic Surgery
ocps.bio: Orange County Plastic Surgery was looking to improve the aesthetic and user experience of their website and boost their SEO around Southern California. During the creation of their website I was responsible for building the landing, procedures, photos, and before & after patient photos pages, all translated via wireframe. The tech we used included Javascript (ES6), HTML, CSS, and jQuery. Since we needed a place to store thousands of photos, I decided to use Contentful as a headless CMS and was responsible for the set up and input of all patients' photos and content, as well as creating the functions to fetch the data and dynamically create individual pages. After the completion and approval of their new site, I used Amazon Web Services for hosting and integrated a chat service, ApexChat.

huntingtondigital.title: Huntington Digital
huntingtondigital.bio: This was a complete rebrand of Huntington Digital's online presence and logo. Their website was very generic and wanted something that better encapsulated their business style and culture. We decided to go with a darker theme with aggressive, red highlights and bright colors throughout with smoooth loading/scroll animations on each section. I was responsible for coding the landing, services, and contact pages from our designer's wireframes with a mobile-first approach. I used PHPMailer to handle the contact form's POST requests. The tech used were Javascript, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3, PHPMailer, and SwiperJS.

pocketstatz.title: Pocket Statz
pocketstatz.bio: Check the latest stats from your favorite sports teams! My love of sports led me to want to create an app to quickly check game stats on the go. This was a fun project that my friend's and I made to help further our learning of React and Redux. The result is a fast loading web app with a mobile-first design in mind including user authentication with persistent login and guest access with saved teams to local storage. The tech used included React, Redux, Axios, SCSS, MySQL, and PHP. All teams data is fetched using Axios from the MySportsFeeds Sports Data API. My roles included creating the overall design and wireframe, creating reusable components, fetching and rendering API data, and assisting in database setup.

salisburyps.title: Salisbury Plastic Surgery
salisburyps.bio: Dr. Deborah Ekstrom wanted to boost her online physique with a new website and brand logo. She enjoyed what we had done with orangecountyplasticsurgery.com and requested we use the same template. I was responsible for adding all images and written content to every page, changing the primary and secondary colors to be cohesive with her new logo, and set up her database in Contentful to fetch patients' photos and blogs. She is extremely happy with her results and her practice's SEO has grown enormously. The tech used included Javascript (ES6), HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, PHPmailer, Contentful, and OwlCarousel.

gutierrezchiro.title: Gutierrez Chiropractic
gutierrezchiro.bio: Mark and Eunice wanted a faster, more modern looking website to go along with their new practice, as well as a new logo. My responsibilies included coding the landing page, procedure pages, and navigation from an existing wireframe along with creating load and scroll animations. The tech used were Javascript, HTML5, CSS3, PHP, and Adobe XD.

travelwell.title: TravelWell
travelwell.bio: Live free, travel well. I wanted to better learn Gatsby so I decided to make a mock travel website. I created all pages and made sure every component was as reusable as possible. Dynamic routing and page creation is handled to render different tour pages and blog posts, and all image loading is performed with GraphQL querying. Contentful is the headless CMS used to hold all tour and blog data, and CSS is handled by Styled Components. The tech used includes Gatsby, GraphQL, Styled Components, and Contentful API. This was a fun project and really helped my working knowledge of Gatsby and React.
